text: Can the lab sections (Introduction, Process, Limitations/Conclusion, References, and Collaboration) be on their own page? I ask because my References section runs on two pages, but only one Reference appears on the second page (see screenshot). Because it is somewhat jarring to have only one reference on a page before starting the Collaboration section, I want to know if it would be better to start the Reference section on its own page before adding the Collaboration section. I hope this makes sense.

elements.text: Can the lab sections (Introduction, Process, Limitations/Conclusion, References, and Collaboration) be on their own page? I ask because my References section runs on two pages, but only one Reference appears on the second page (see screenshot). Because it is somewhat jarring to have only one reference on a page before starting the Collaboration section, I want to know if it would be better to start the Reference section on its own page before adding the Collaboration section. I hope this makes sense.

text:
That's a great question!
My advice is to add page breaks, or adjust the formatting to make things as clear, organized, and readable as possible.

elements.text:
That's a great question!
My advice is to add page breaks, or adjust the formatting to make things as clear, organized, and readable as possible.

text: Hey Sara! The lab sections can definitely be on their own page. I think that would make it easier for you and the instructor to look at. Feel free to create a new page for the Collaboration Section.

elements.text: Hey Sara! The lab sections can definitely be on their own page. I think that would make it easier for you and the instructor to look at. Feel free to create a new page for the Collaboration Section.

text: For the part of the lab template *"Step X: Title"*, is this part going to be for documenting each breakpoint? For example "Step 1: Screenshot of slack profile, Step 2: My menu taskbar, and so on.

elements.text: For the part of the lab template
"Step X: Title"
, is this part going to be for documenting each breakpoint? For example "Step 1: Screenshot of slack profile, Step 2: My menu taskbar, and so on.

text:
Hello <@U04L09GTVBK>

In the lab template, I am not aware of a part that says "Step X: Title". Do you mean "Lab XX -- Title" or am I missing something? If you are talking about "Lab XX -- Title", I believe you just replace the XX's with the Lab number (00) the Title with the lab's name (Reporting).

elements.text: Hello

In the lab template, I am not aware of a part that says "Step X: Title". Do you mean "Lab XX -- Title" or am I missing something? If you are talking about "Lab XX -- Title", I believe you just replace the XX's with the Lab number (00) the Title with the lab's name (Reporting).

text: <@U04L09GTVBK> You document the breakpoints under the Process section of the Lab Template. In the instructions PDF it says "The process portion of this lab contains instructions for the actual work of the lab. Work through these steps systemically. Breakpoints indicate required spots at which you should stop and document your work." I hope this helps.

text: Chiming in here in case it helps. <@U04L09GTVBK>: It would be great if you included the step number and title for each step, as in the instructions. For example, *Step 1: Practice Taking a Screenshot.*  Headings are helpful in walking the reader through your process. So you would have a header for each step. I just provided one step in the template.

elements.text: Chiming in here in case it helps.

text: Do both steps and breakpoints need to be listed in the lab template in the order we're given on the pdf?

elements.text: Do both steps and breakpoints need to be listed in the lab template in the order we're given on the pdf?

text: <@U04L3P6AAGH>  The instructions in the PDF say " Breakpoints indicate required spots at which you should stop and document your work (you are free to document more than this!). If any of these steps are a review for you, take it to the next level and document further in some way! " To me, it seems that only the Breakpoints are required. Also, according to the rubric, the Breakpoints are what you will be graded on. But, you are free to include the steps as well.

elements.text: The instructions in the PDF say " Breakpoints indicate required spots at which you should stop and document your work (you are free to document more than this!). If any of these steps are a review for you, take it to the next level and document further in some way! " To me, it seems that only the Breakpoints are required. Also, according to the rubric, the Breakpoints are what you will be graded on. But, you are free to include the steps as well.

text: Okay, Thank you. They were kind of contradicting directions in my mind so I wanted some clarification.

elements.text: Okay, Thank you. They were kind of contradicting directions in my mind so I wanted some clarification.

text: There is a correlating breakpoint for each step. The template has a heading for the step so that you have a title alongside, but you are only answering the breakpoint for that step. Some of the step's instructions may be appropriate to include. You can make that determination.
